com.github.wuic.xml

Class XmlContextBuilderConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.wuic.util.PollingScheduler<ContextBuilderConfigurator>
      • com.github.wuic.context.ContextBuilderConfigurator
        • com.github.wuic.xml.XmlContextBuilderConfigurator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileXmlContextBuilderConfigurator, ReaderXmlContextBuilderConfigurator

    public abstract class XmlContextBuilderConfigurator
extends ContextBuilderConfigurator

    This configurator implements XML supports for WUIC. It abstracts the way the XML is read and unmarshal with JAXB.

    Since:
    0.4.0
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Guillaume DROUET

        public static void configureTemplates(XmlWuicBean xml,
                      ContextBuilder ctxBuilder)
                               throws WorkflowTemplateNotFoundException,
                                      IOException

        Configures the given builder with the template in the specified bean.

        An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the workflow is badly defined.

        Parameters:
        xml - the bean
        ctxBuilder - the builder
        Throws:
        WorkflowTemplateNotFoundException - if a workflow-template-id reference a non existing template
        IOException - if any I/O error occurs

        Returns:
        the process context

      • internalConfigure

        public int internalConfigure(ContextBuilder ctxBuilder)

        Configures the given context internally. This method is called just after the ContextBuilder has been tagged with the value returned by ContextBuilderConfigurator.getTag() method. Once the execution of this method is terminated, the tag is released.

        To activate polling on this configurator, this method should returns a positive integer representing the polling interval in seconds.

        Specified by:
        internalConfigure in class ContextBuilderConfigurator
        Parameters:
        ctxBuilder - the builder

      • unmarshal

        Unmashal the XmlWuicBean with the given unmarhalled.

        Parameters:
        unmarshaller - the unmarshaller
        Returns:
        the unmarshalled bean
        Throws:
        JAXBException - if the XML can't be read
